props.name: Rule_Description

props.name: Parameter_Description_0
props.value: Enter an appropriate login banner for your organization according to the local policy.

props.name: Parameter_Value_Alternatives_0
props.value: {'default': 'Authorized users only. All activity may be monitored and reported.', 'cis': 'Authorized users only. All activity may be monitored and reported.'}

props.name: Parameter_Description_1
props.value: Choose allowed duration (in seconds) of inactive graphical sessions

props.name: Parameter_Description_2
props.value: Enter an appropriate login banner for your organization. Please note that new lines must be expressed by the '\n' character and special characters like parentheses and quotation marks must be escaped with '\\'.

props.name: Parameter_Description_3
props.value: Specify duration of allowed idle time.

props.name: Parameter_Description_4
props.value: Specify the maximum number of authentication attempts per connection.

props.name: Parameter_Description_5
props.value: Specify the FIPS approved KEXs (Key Exchange Algorithms) algorithms 	that are used for methods in cryptography by which cryptographic keys are exchanged between two parties

props.name: Parameter_Description_6
props.value: Specify the FIPS approved MACs (Message Authentication Code) algorithms 	that are used for data integrity protection by the SSH server.

props.name: Parameter_Description_8
props.value: Trackers could be using source-routed packets to generate traffic that seems to be intra-net, but actually was created outside and has been redirected.

props.name: Parameter_Description_9
props.value: Disable so you don't Log Spoofed Packets, Source Routed Packets, Redirect Packets

props.name: Parameter_Description_10
props.value: Enable to enforce sanity checking, also called ingress filtering or egress filtering. The point is to drop a packet if the source and destination IP addresses in the IP header do not make sense when considered in light of the physical interface on which it arrived.

props.name: Parameter_Description_11
props.value: Enable to prevent hijacking of routing path by only allowing redirects from gateways known in routing table. Disable to refuse acceptance of secure ICMP redirected packets on all interfaces.

props.name: Parameter_Description_14
props.value: Disable so you don't Log Spoofed Packets, Source Routed Packets, Redirect Packets

props.name: Parameter_Description_16
props.value: Enable to prevent hijacking of routing path by only allowing redirects from gateways known in routing table. Disable to refuse acceptance of secure ICMP redirected packages by default.

props.name: Parameter_Description_17
props.value: Ignore all ICMP ECHO and TIMESTAMP requests sent to it via broadcast/multicast

props.name: Parameter_Description_19
props.value: Enable to turn on TCP SYN Cookie Protection

props.name: Parameter_Description_22
props.value: Trackers could be using source-routed packets to generate traffic that seems to be intra-net, but actually was created outside and has been redirected.

props.name: Parameter_Description_24
props.value: Accept default router advertisements by default?

props.name: Parameter_Description_25
props.value: Toggle ICMP Redirect Acceptance By Default

props.name: Parameter_Description_26
props.value: Trackers could be using source-routed packets to generate traffic that seems to be intra-net, but actually was created outside and has been redirected.

props.name: Parameter_Description_27
props.value: The number of days to wait after a password expires, until the account will be permanently disabled.

props.name: Parameter_Description_28
props.value: Maximum age of password in days

props.name: Parameter_Description_29
props.value: The number of days' warning given before a password expires.

props.name: Parameter_Description_30
props.value: Number of failed login attempts before account lockout

props.name: Parameter_Description_31
props.value: Seconds before automatic unlocking or permanently locking after excessive failed logins

props.name: Parameter_Description_32
props.value: In an interactive shell, the value is interpreted as the number of seconds to wait for input after issuing the primary prompt. Bash terminates after waiting for that number of seconds if input does not arrive.

props.name: Parameter_Description_34
props.value: The list of vendor-approved time servers

props.name: Parameter_Description_35
props.value: pam_wheel module has a parameter called group, which controls which groups can access the su command. This variable holds the valid value for the parameter.

props.name: Parameter_Description_36
props.value: Specify the system default encryption algorithm for encrypting passwords. Defines the value set as ENCRYPT_METHOD in /etc/login.defs.

props.name: Parameter_Description_37
props.value: Specify the system default encryption algorithm for encrypting passwords. Defines the hashing algorithm to be used in pam_unix.so.

props.name: Parameter_Description_38
props.value: Prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.

props.value: Minimum number of characters not present in old password

props.value: Prevent password re-use using password history lookup

props.name: Parameter_Description_44
props.value: 'Specify the control flag required for password remember requirement. If multiple values are allowed write them separated by commas as in "required,requisite", for remediations the first value will be taken'

Type of policy in use. Possible values are:
targeted - Only targeted network daemons are protected.
strict - Full SELinux protection.
mls - Multiple levels of security

implemented-requirements.description: This is a helper rule to reload Dconf database correctly.

There is no automated remediation for this rule and this is intentional.
More details in the rule description.

implemented-requirements.description:
Many of the libvirt packages used by Enterprise Linux virtualization are dependent on the
nfs-utils package.

Many of the libvirt packages used by Enterprise Linux virtualization, and the nfs-utils
package used for The Network File System (NFS), are dependent on the rpcbind package.

The rule has_nonlocal_mta currently checks for services listening only on port 25,
but the policy checks also for ports 465 and 587

It is necessary to create a rule to ensure the existence of at.allow.
file_cron_allow_exists can be used as reference for a new templated rule.

RHEL systems use firewalld for firewall management. Although nftables is the default
back-end for firewalld, it is not recommended to use nftables directly when firewalld
is in use. When using firewalld the base chains are installed by default.

RHEL systems use firewalld for firewall management. Although nftables is the default
back-end for firewalld, it is not recommended to use nftables directly when firewalld
is in use.

RHEL systems use firewalld for firewall management. Although nftables is the default
back-end for firewalld, it is not recommended to use nftables directly when firewalld
is in use.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks:
The status was automated but we need to double check the approach used in this rule.
Therefore I moved it to pending until deeper investigation.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks:
The status was automated but we need to double check the approach used in this rule.
Therefore I moved it to pending until deeper investigation.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks:
The status was automated but we need to double check the approach used in this rule.
Therefore I moved it to pending until deeper investigation.

implemented-requirements.description:
The requirement gives an example of 45 seconds, but is flexible about the values. It is only
necessary to ensure there is a timeout configured in alignment to the site policy.

The CIS benchmark is not opinionated about which loglevel is selected here. Here, this
profile uses VERBOSE by default, as it allows for the capture of login and logout activity
as well as key fingerprints.

Members of "wheel" or GID 0 groups are checked by default if the group option is not set for
pam_wheel.so module. The recommendation states the group should be empty to reinforce the
use of "sudo" for privileged access. Therefore, members of these groups should be manually
checked or a different group should be informed.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: It is necessary a new rule to ensure PAM package is updated.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: It is necessary a new rule to ensure authselect package is updated.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: It is necessary a new rule to ensure libpwquality package is updated.

implemented-requirements.description:
This requirement is hard to be automated without any specific requirement. The policy even
states that provided commands are examples, other custom settings might be in place and the
settings might be different depending on site policies. The other rules will already make
sure there is a correct autheselect profile regardless of the existing settings. It is
necessary to better discuss with CIS Community.
This requirement is also indirectly satisfied by the requirement 5.3.3.1.
This requirement is also indirectly satisfied by the requirement 5.3.3.2.

The module is properly enabled by the rules mentioned in related_rules.
Requirements in 5.3.3.3 use these rules.

This module is always present by default. It is necessary to investigate if a new rule to
check its existence needs to be created. But so far the rule no_empty_passwords, used in
5.3.3.4.1 can ensure this requirement is attended.

The policy also accepts value 0, which means the locked accounts should be manually unlocked
by an administrator. However, it also mentions that using value 0 can facilitate a DoS
attack to legitimate users.

This requirement is expected to be manual. However, in previous versions of the policy
it was already automated the configuration of "minclass" option. Rules related to other
options are informed in related_rules. In short, minclass=4 alone can achieve the same
result achieved by the combination of the other 4 options mentioned in the policy.

Although mentioned in the section 5.3.3.3, there is no explicit requirement to configure
retry option of pam_pwhistory. If come in the future, the rule accounts_password_pam_retry
can be used.

pam_pwhistory is enabled via authselect feature, as required in 5.3.2.4. The
feature automatically set "use_authok" option. In any case, we don't have a rule to check
this option specifically.
The rule more specifically used in this requirement also satify the requirement 5.3.2.5.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks:
Usage of pam_unix.so module together with "remember" option is deprecated and is not
recommened by this policy. Instead, it should be used remember option of pam_pwhistory
module, as required in 5.3.3.3.1. See here for more details about pam_unix.so:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1778929
A new rule needs to be created to remove the remember option from pam_unix module.

implemented-requirements.description: Changes in logindefs mentioned in this requirement are more specifically covered by 5.4.1.4

In RHEL 9 pam_unix is enabled by default in all authselect profiles already with the
use_authtok option set. In any case, we don't have a rule to check this option specifically,
like in 5.3.3.3.3.

There's a "new" set of options in /etc/login.defs file to define the number of iterations
performed during the hashing process.

The rule confirms the primary group for root, but doesn't check if any other user are also
using GID 0. New rule is necessary.
There is assessment but no automated remediation for this rule and this sounds reasonable.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks:
There is no rule to ensure umask in /root/.bash_profile and /root/.bashrc. A new rule have
to be created. It can be based on accounts_umask_interactive_users.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks:
It is necessary to create a new rule to check the status of journald and rsyslog.
It would also be necessary a new rule to disable or remove rsyslog.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: This rule conflicts with 6.2.3.3. More investigation is needed to properly solve this.

implemented-requirements.description: It is not harmful to run these rules even if rsyslog is not installed or active.
Missing a rule to check that .bash_history is mode 0600 or more restrictive.

props.value: Enter an appropriate login banner for your organization. Please note that new lines must be expressed by the '\n' character and special characters like parentheses and quotation marks must be escaped with '\\'.

props.value: Trackers could be using source-routed packets to generate traffic that seems to be intra-net, but actually was created outside and has been redirected.

props.name: Parameter_Description_10
props.value: Enable to enforce sanity checking, also called ingress filtering or egress filtering. The point is to drop a packet if the source and destination IP addresses in the IP header do not make sense when considered in light of the physical interface on which it arrived.

props.name: Parameter_Description_11
props.value: Enable to prevent hijacking of routing path by only allowing redirects from gateways known in routing table. Disable to refuse acceptance of secure ICMP redirected packets on all interfaces.

props.name: Parameter_Description_14
props.value: Disable so you don't Log Spoofed Packets, Source Routed Packets, Redirect Packets

props.name: Parameter_Description_16
props.value: Enable to prevent hijacking of routing path by only allowing redirects from gateways known in routing table. Disable to refuse acceptance of secure ICMP redirected packages by default.

props.name: Parameter_Description_17

props.name: Parameter_Description_19

props.value: Toggle ICMP Redirect Acceptance By Default

props.name: Parameter_Description_26
props.value: Trackers could be using source-routed packets to generate traffic that seems to be intra-net, but actually was created outside and has been redirected.

props.name: Parameter_Description_27
props.value: The number of days to wait after a password expires, until the account will be permanently disabled.

props.name: Parameter_Description_28
props.value: Maximum age of password in days

props.name: Parameter_Description_29
props.value: The number of days' warning given before a password expires.

props.name: Parameter_Description_30
props.value: Number of failed login attempts before account lockout

props.name: Parameter_Description_31
props.value: Seconds before automatic unlocking or permanently locking after excessive failed logins

props.name: Parameter_Description_32
props.value: In an interactive shell, the value is interpreted as the number of seconds to wait for input after issuing the primary prompt. Bash terminates after waiting for that number of seconds if input does not arrive.

props.name: Parameter_Description_34
props.value: The list of vendor-approved time servers

props.name: Parameter_Description_35
props.value: pam_wheel module has a parameter called group, which controls which groups can access the su command. This variable holds the valid value for the parameter.

props.name: Parameter_Description_36
props.value: Specify the system default encryption algorithm for encrypting passwords. Defines the value set as ENCRYPT_METHOD in /etc/login.defs.

props.name: Parameter_Description_37
props.value: Specify the system default encryption algorithm for encrypting passwords. Defines the hashing algorithm to be used in pam_unix.so.

props.name: Parameter_Description_38
props.value: Prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.

props.name: Parameter_Description_39
props.value: Minimum number of characters not present in old password

props.name: Parameter_Description_40
props.value: Maximum Number of Consecutive Repeating Characters in a Password

props.name: Parameter_Description_41
props.value: Minimum number of categories of characters that must exist in a password

props.name: Parameter_Description_42
props.value: Minimum number of characters in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_43
props.value: Prevent password re-use using password history lookup

props.name: Parameter_Description_44
props.value: 'Specify the control flag required for password remember requirement. If multiple values are allowed write them separated by commas as in "required,requisite", for remediations the first value will be taken'

props.name: Parameter_Description_46
props.value: Choose allowed duration (in seconds) after a screensaver becomes active before displaying an authentication prompt

props.name: Parameter_Description_47
props.value:
Type of policy in use. Possible values are:
targeted - Only targeted network daemons are protected.
strict - Full SELinux protection.
mls - Multiple levels of security

props.name: Parameter_Description_48
props.value: Specify the maximum number of open sessions permitted.

props.name: Parameter_Description_49
props.value: Specify the maximum number of idle message counts before session is terminated.

props.name: Parameter_Description_50
props.value: Configure parameters for how long the servers stays connected before the user has successfully logged in

props.name: Parameter_Description_51
props.value: Configure parameters for maximum concurrent unauthenticated connections to the SSH daemon.

props.name: Parameter_Description_52
props.value: Specify the crypto policy for the system.

props.name: Parameter_Description_53
props.value: 'A regular expression describing a list of file names for files that are sourced at login time for interactive users'

implemented-requirements.description:
Many of the libvirt packages used by Enterprise Linux virtualization are dependent on the
nfs-utils package.

Many of the libvirt packages used by Enterprise Linux virtualization, and the nfs-utils
package used for The Network File System (NFS), are dependent on the rpcbind package.

The rule has_nonlocal_mta currently checks for services listening only on port 25,
but the policy checks also for ports 465 and 587

It is necessary to create a rule to ensure the existence of at.allow.
file_cron_allow_exists can be used as reference for a new templated rule.

RHEL systems use firewalld for firewall management. Although nftables is the default
back-end for firewalld, it is not recommended to use nftables directly when firewalld
is in use. When using firewalld the base chains are installed by default.

back-end for firewalld, it is not recommended to use nftables directly when firewalld
is in use.

back-end for firewalld, it is not recommended to use nftables directly when firewalld
is in use.

implemented-requirements.description:
The requirement gives an example of 45 seconds, but is flexible about the values. It is only
necessary to ensure there is a timeout configured in alignment to the site policy.

The CIS benchmark is not opinionated about which loglevel is selected here. Here, this
profile uses VERBOSE by default, as it allows for the capture of login and logout activity
as well as key fingerprints.

Members of "wheel" or GID 0 groups are checked by default if the group option is not set for
pam_wheel.so module. The recommendation states the group should be empty to reinforce the
use of "sudo" for privileged access. Therefore, members of these groups should be manually
checked or a different group should be informed.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: It is necessary a new rule to ensure PAM package is updated.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: It is necessary a new rule to ensure authselect package is updated.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: It is necessary a new rule to ensure libpwquality package is updated.

implemented-requirements.description:
This requirement is hard to be automated without any specific requirement. The policy even
states that provided commands are examples, other custom settings might be in place and the
settings might be different depending on site policies. The other rules will already make
sure there is a correct autheselect profile regardless of the existing settings. It is
necessary to better discuss with CIS Community.
This requirement is also indirectly satisfied by the requirement 5.3.3.1.
This requirement is also indirectly satisfied by the requirement 5.3.3.2.

The module is properly enabled by the rules mentioned in related_rules.
Requirements in 5.3.3.3 use these rules.

This module is always present by default. It is necessary to investigate if a new rule to
check its existence needs to be created. But so far the rule no_empty_passwords, used in
5.3.3.4.1 can ensure this requirement is attended.

The policy also accepts value 0, which means the locked accounts should be manually unlocked
by an administrator. However, it also mentions that using value 0 can facilitate a DoS
attack to legitimate users.

This requirement is expected to be manual. However, in previous versions of the policy
it was already automated the configuration of "minclass" option. Rules related to other
options are informed in related_rules. In short, minclass=4 alone can achieve the same
result achieved by the combination of the other 4 options mentioned in the policy.

Although mentioned in the section 5.3.3.3, there is no explicit requirement to configure
retry option of pam_pwhistory. If come in the future, the rule accounts_password_pam_retry
can be used.

pam_pwhistory is enabled via authselect feature, as required in 5.3.2.4. The
feature automatically set "use_authok" option. In any case, we don't have a rule to check
this option specifically.
The rule more specifically used in this requirement also satify the requirement 5.3.2.5.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks:
Usage of pam_unix.so module together with "remember" option is deprecated and is not
recommened by this policy. Instead, it should be used remember option of pam_pwhistory
module, as required in 5.3.3.3.1. See here for more details about pam_unix.so:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1778929
A new rule needs to be created to remove the remember option from pam_unix module.

implemented-requirements.description: Changes in logindefs mentioned in this requirement are more specifically covered by 5.4.1.4

In RHEL 9 pam_unix is enabled by default in all authselect profiles already with the
use_authtok option set. In any case, we don't have a rule to check this option specifically,
like in 5.3.3.3.3.

There's a "new" set of options in /etc/login.defs file to define the number of iterations
performed during the hashing process.

The rule confirms the primary group for root, but doesn't check if any other user are also
using GID 0. New rule is necessary.
There is assessment but no automated remediation for this rule and this sounds reasonable.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks:
There is no rule to ensure umask in /root/.bash_profile and /root/.bashrc. A new rule have
to be created. It can be based on accounts_umask_interactive_users.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks:
It is necessary to create a new rule to check the status of journald and rsyslog.
It would also be necessary a new rule to disable or remove rsyslog.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: This rule conflicts with 6.2.3.3. More investigation is needed to properly solve this.

implemented-requirements.description: It is not harmful to run these rules even if rsyslog is not installed or active.
Missing a rule to check that .bash_history is mode 0600 or more restrictive.
